str2: If. A primary particle of conditionality; if, whether, that, etc.
For. A primary particle; properly, assigning a reason.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To flee from, escape. From apo and pheugo; to escape.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Pollution, defilement; a stain. From miaino; foulness.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Probably from the base of komizo; orderly arrangement, i.e. Decoration; by implication, the world (morally).
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
From epiginosko; recognition, i.e. full discernment, acknowledgement.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.
And, even, also, namely.
A savior, deliverer, preserver. From sozo; a deliverer, i.e. God or Christ.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.
Anointed One; the Messiah, the Christ. From chrio; Anointed One, i.e. The Messiah, an epithet of Jesus.
A primary particle; but, and, etc.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Passive - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To enfold, entangle; pass: To be involved in. From en and pleko; to entwine, i.e. involve with.

parse: Verb - Perfect Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Plural
str2: From the same as hetton; to make worse, i.e. Vanquish; by implication, to rate lower.
This; he, she, it.
Probably from the same as pale; anew, i.e. back, once more, or furthermore or on the other hand.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
Last, at the last, finally, till the end. A superlative probably from echo; farthest, final.

parse: Verb - Perfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: A prolongation and middle voice form of a primary verb; to cause to be, i.e. to become, used with great latitude.
Worse, more severe. Irregular comparative of kakos; from an obsolete equivalent cheres; more evil or aggravated.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
First, before, principal, most important. Contracted superlative of pro; foremost.
